result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J. Ziehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be determined through a restitution hearing before the Comm.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Attend High School and complete that.   
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.  
*  Pay resitution plus surcharges.  Restitution hearing to be held before Comm.   
Perform  100  hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

Ct. 2
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Aaron J. Ziehr, appeared with Attorney Lara Parker.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification and case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  15CM1018 is read in and sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  As a condition DE is ordered to complete 100 hours of Community Service.  Restitution shall be determined through a restitution hearing before Comm. Dowse.  See conditions.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Lara Parker appeared on behalf of Defendant, Aaron Ziehr who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Parker states DE is unable to appear as he is currently in Rogers Memorial Hospital.  Atty Parker requests bond be modified in 15CM1018 to allow DE to return home with his mother who is in court.  Upon hearing arguments court grants motion and bond shall be modified to no violent contact with C.Z.  Atty Parker will bring DE to RM 204 to sign the amended bond om 15CM1018 upon his release which may be this afternoon.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 10:40 am.
Atty Lara Parker
